This is a first pass at making a haiku generator. I am both not a poet and very lazy so this randomize will create a 5-7-5 poem (most of the time, some of the training data has 3-9-5 structure) using a massive list of potential phrases appropriate for the task. I hope you enjoy!

```{r setup, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)

haiku <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/herval/creative_machines/master/haikuzao/src/main/resources/haiku.txt", 
                  col_names = FALSE)

haiku$order<-rep(1:3,length.out = nrow(haiku)) 

haiku1<-haiku %>% filter(order==1)
haiku2<-haiku %>% filter(order==2)
haiku3<-haiku %>% filter(order==3)

line1<-str_to_title(sample(haiku1$X1,1))
line2<-str_to_title(sample(haiku2$X1,1))
line3<-str_to_title(sample(haiku3$X1,1))

```

```{r hakiu, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE}

finsihed_hakiu<-cat(paste0(line1,"\n",
       line2,"\n",
       line3))
```
